thread.title: Miami Dolphins fire defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle
thread.title_full: Miami Dolphins fire defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle

title: Miami Dolphins fire defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle
text:
Miami Dolphins fire defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle 
Story by CBS12 Web teamMIAMI (CBS12) -- The Miami Dolphins fired defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle.Coyle's firing comes days after the team fired head coach Joe Philbin.Defensive Backs coach Lou Anarumo has been promoted to replace Coyle.The Dolphins are 1-3 on the season. The team lost 3-straight following its season-opening win against the Washington Redskins. The Dolphins have a bye week and return to the field at home Oct. 18 against the Tennessee Titans.The Dolphins expected big things in 2015 after spending $155.5 million on free agents, $126.3 million on contract extensions, $28 million on draft picks, and $28.4 million on undrafted free agents.Defensive tackle Ndamukong Suh came over from the Detroit Lions for $114 million. The defense has been riddled with injuries. Free safety Louis Delmas is out for the year. Cameron Wake is also hampered by injury.The Miami Dolphins are ranked 30th in total defense, just above the Oakland Raiders and Cleveland Browns.The Dolphins made a few more announcements Thursday about the coaching staff.Jeff Burris is being promoted to assistant defensive backs coach.Assistant coach Blue Adams will continue to work with the safeties. Miami Dolphins fire defensive coordinator Kevin Coyle 
Thursday, October 8 2015, 05:46 PM
